recipes.name: Butter Chicken
instructions: Cut 500g chicken into bite-sized pieces and marinate with 1 cup yogurt, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric, and salt for 2 hours in refrigerator
Heat 2 tbsp butter in a pan, add marinated chicken and cook until lightly browned (8-10 minutes). Remove and set aside
In same pan, add 2 tbsp butter, sauté 2 finely chopped onions until golden brown
Add 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, cook for 1 minute until fragrant
Add 4 pureed tomatoes, cook for 8-10 minutes until oil separates from masala
Add 1 tsp garam masala, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric, and salt. Cook for 2 minutes
Add 1/2 cup water and cooked chicken. Simmer for 10 minutes
Add 1/2 cup fresh cream and 1 tsp kasuri methi. Mix well and cook for 2 minutes
Garnish with fresh cream and coriander. Serve hot with naan or rice
recipes.description: Creamy and rich chicken in tomato gravy

recipes.name: Masala Dosa
instructions: Soak 2 cups rice and 1/2 cup urad dal separately for 6 hours
Grind rice and dal separately to smooth batter, then mix together
Add salt and let batter ferment overnight (8-12 hours) in warm place
For potato masala: Boil 4 potatoes, peel and mash coarsely
Heat 2 tbsp oil in pan, add 1 tsp mustard seeds, 1 tsp chana dal, 10 curry leaves
Add 2 chopped onions, 2 green chilies, 1 inch ginger (chopped). Sauté until onions turn translucent
Add 1/2 tsp turmeric, salt, and mashed potatoes. Mix well and cook for 5 minutes
Add 2 tbsp water if too dry. Keep potato masala aside
Heat dosa tawa, pour ladle of batter and spread in circular motion to make thin dosa
Drizzle oil around edges, cook until golden and crispy
Place 2 tbsp potato masala in center, fold dosa. Serve with coconut chutney and sambar
recipes.description: Crispy fermented crepe with spiced potato filling

recipes.name: Palak Paneer
instructions: Wash and clean 500g spinach leaves. Blanch in boiling water for 2 minutes
Immediately transfer to ice water to retain green color. Drain and blend to smooth puree
Cut 250g paneer into cubes and soak in warm water for 10 minutes to keep soft
Heat 2 tbsp oil, add 1 tsp cumin seeds. When they splutter, add 2 chopped onions
Sauté onions until golden brown. Add 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, cook for 1 minute
Add 2 chopped tomatoes, cook until soft and mushy (5-7 minutes)
Add 1 tsp garam masala, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1 tsp red chili powder. Cook for 2 minutes
Add spinach puree and cook for 8-10 minutes on medium heat
Add paneer cubes, 1/2 cup cream, and salt. Simmer for 5 minutes
Garnish with cream and serve hot with roti or naan
recipes.description: Cottage cheese in creamy spinach gravy

recipes.name: Hyderabadi Biryani
instructions: Wash and soak 2 cups basmati rice for 30 minutes
Marinate 500g chicken with 1 cup yogurt, 2 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 2 tbsp biryani masala, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric, and salt for 2 hours
Slice 3 onions thinly and deep fry until golden brown. Keep aside
Boil rice with 2 bay leaves, 4 cloves, 2 cardamom until 70% cooked. Drain and keep aside
In heavy-bottomed pot, layer marinated chicken at bottom
Sprinkle half of fried onions, 1/4 cup mint leaves, 1/4 cup coriander leaves
Layer partially cooked rice over chicken. Add remaining fried onions, mint, coriander
Mix 1/4 tsp saffron in 2 tbsp warm milk and drizzle over rice
Add 2 tbsp ghee and 1/4 cup water around edges
Cover with tight lid, seal with dough if possible. Cook on low heat (dum) for 25 minutes
Let it rest for 10 minutes before serving. Mix gently and serve with raita
recipes.description: Aromatic rice with marinated chicken and spices

recipes.name: Idli with Sambar
instructions: Soak 2 cups rice and 1/2 cup urad dal separately for 4 hours
Grind urad dal to fluffy batter, rice to slightly coarse batter. Mix together
Add salt and ferment for 8-12 hours in warm place until batter doubles
Grease idli molds with oil, pour batter and steam for 10-12 minutes
For sambar: Pressure cook 1/2 cup toor dal with 1/4 tsp turmeric until soft
Soak lemon-sized tamarind in warm water for 15 minutes, extract juice
Cook 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrot, beans, pumpkin) with tamarind extract, 2 tbsp sambar powder, and salt
Mash cooked dal and add to vegetables. Simmer for 10 minutes
For tempering: Heat 2 tbsp oil, add 1 tsp mustard seeds, 1 tsp urad dal, 10 curry leaves, 2 dry red chilies
Add tempering to sambar. Garnish with coriander
Serve soft idlis with hot sambar and coconut chutney
recipes.description: Soft steamed rice cakes with lentil stew

recipes.name: Chole Bhature
instructions: Soak 2 cups chickpeas overnight with 2 tea bags for dark color
Pressure cook chickpeas with salt, 1 tea bag, and 1 black cardamom until soft
Heat 3 tbsp oil, add 1 tsp cumin seeds, 2 chopped onions. Sauté until golden
Add 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, cook for 1 minute. Add 3 chopped tomatoes, cook until soft
Add 2 tbsp chole masala, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric. Cook for 2 minutes
Add cooked chickpeas with some water. Simmer for 15 minutes. Mash some chickpeas for thickness
For bhature: Mix 2 cups maida, 1/4 cup yogurt, 1/2 tsp baking powder, 1 tsp sugar, salt
Knead to soft dough with water. Rest for 4 hours covered
Divide dough into balls, roll into circles. Deep fry in hot oil until puffed and golden
Serve hot bhature with chole, sliced onions, and lemon wedges
recipes.description: Spicy chickpeas with fluffy fried bread

recipes.name: Pongal
instructions: Dry roast 1/2 cup moong dal until aromatic (3-4 minutes on medium heat)
Wash 1 cup rice and roasted dal together. Pressure cook with 4 cups water, 1 inch ginger (crushed), and salt for 4 whistles
Mash the cooked rice-dal mixture slightly with ladle
For tempering: Heat 3 tbsp ghee, add 1 tsp cumin seeds, 1 tsp pepper corns, 10 curry leaves
Add 2 tbsp cashews and fry until golden. Add 1 inch ginger (julienned)
Add tempering to cooked pongal. Mix well
Add more hot water if needed for desired consistency
Serve hot with sambar or coconut chutney. Perfect breakfast for cold mornings

recipes.name: Rogan Josh
instructions: Cut 500g lamb into 2-inch pieces. Marinate with 1/2 cup yogurt, 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, and salt for 2 hours
Heat 3 tbsp oil, brown lamb pieces on all sides. Remove and set aside
In same oil, sauté 3 sliced onions until golden brown (10-12 minutes)
Add 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, cook for 1 minute until fragrant
Add 2 tbsp Kashmiri chili powder (mixed with 2 tbsp water to prevent burning)
Cook chili paste in oil for 2 minutes until oil separates
Add 1 tsp fennel powder, 1 tsp garam masala, 1/2 cup yogurt. Cook for 3 minutes
Add browned lamb and 2 cups water. Pressure cook for 6-7 whistles or until tender
If using pot, simmer covered for 1.5-2 hours until lamb is tender
Garnish with coriander and ginger juliennes. Serve with naan or rice

recipes.name: Medu Vada
instructions: Soak 1 cup urad dal for 4 hours. Drain completely (no water remaining)
Grind dal to smooth, fluffy batter without adding water (use sprinkles if needed)
Add 1 tsp crushed pepper, 1 tsp cumin, 1 inch ginger (finely chopped), 2 green chilies (chopped), 10 curry leaves (chopped), and salt
Beat batter well for 5-7 minutes until light and airy (this makes vada soft)
Add 1 tbsp rice flour for crispiness. Mix well
Heat oil for deep frying. Wet your hands, take lemon-sized batter
Make hole in center with thumb to form donut shape. Gently slide into hot oil
Fry on medium heat until golden brown and crispy (3-4 minutes per side)
Drain on paper towel. Serve hot with sambar and coconut chutney

recipes.name: Tandoori Chicken
instructions: Make deep cuts on 8 chicken pieces (legs and thighs) for marinade to penetrate
Pat dry chicken completely with paper towels
Prepare marinade: Mix 1 cup thick yogurt, 2 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 2 tbsp Kashmiri chili powder, 1 tbsp garam masala, 1 tsp turmeric, 2 tbsp mustard oil, juice of 1 lemon, and salt
Apply marinade generously on chicken, making sure it goes into cuts
Cover and refrigerate for 6-8 hours or overnight
Preheat oven to 200°C (400°F). Arrange chicken on wire rack
Bake for 20-25 minutes, then turn and bake for another 15-20 minutes
Brush with butter or oil halfway through cooking
Switch to grill mode for last 5 minutes for charred effect
Serve hot with onion rings, lemon wedges, and mint chutney

recipes.name: Upma
instructions: Dry roast 1 cup rava (semolina) on medium heat until fragrant and light golden (5-7 minutes). Keep aside
Heat 3 tbsp oil/ghee, add 1 tsp mustard seeds. When they splutter, add 1 tsp urad dal, 1 tsp chana dal
When dals turn golden, add 10 curry leaves, 2 dry red chilies
Add 1 chopped onion, sauté until translucent. Add 1 inch ginger (chopped), 2 green chilies (slit)
Add 1/4 cup mixed vegetables (carrot, peas, beans). Sauté for 2 minutes
Add 2.5 cups water, salt to taste. Bring to rolling boil
Reduce heat to low, slowly add roasted rava while stirring continuously to avoid lumps
Cover and cook on low heat for 5 minutes. Add 1 tbsp ghee and mix well
Garnish with coriander and serve hot with chutney or sugar

recipes.name: Dal Makhani
instructions: Soak 1 cup black dal (whole urad) and 1/4 cup kidney beans overnight
Pressure cook with 4 cups water, 1/2 tsp turmeric, and salt for 6-7 whistles until completely soft
Heat 3 tbsp butter, add 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste. Cook for 1 minute
Add 2 pureed tomatoes, cook for 8-10 minutes until oil separates
Add 1 tsp garam masala, 1 tsp red chili powder. Cook for 2 minutes
Add cooked dal and beans. Simmer for 30 minutes on low heat, stirring occasionally
Mash some dal with back of spoon against pot walls to thicken gravy
Add 1/2 cup fresh cream, 2 tbsp butter, and 1 tsp kasuri methi. Cook for 15 minutes
Garnish with cream and butter. Serve hot with naan or rice

recipes.name: Pesarattu
instructions: Soak 1 cup green gram (whole moong) and 2 tbsp rice for 6 hours
Drain and grind to smooth batter with 1 inch ginger, 2 green chilies, and little water
Batter should be of pouring consistency (like dosa batter)
Add 1 tsp cumin seeds and salt to batter. Rest for 30 minutes
Heat dosa tawa, pour ladle of batter and spread thin like dosa
Drizzle oil around edges. Sprinkle finely chopped onions and green chilies on top
Cook on medium heat until bottom is golden and crispy (3-4 minutes)
Flip and cook other side for 1 minute if desired
Serve hot with ginger chutney or allam pachadi
No fermentation needed. Healthy and protein-rich breakfast

recipes.name: Malai Kofta
instructions: For kofta: Grate 200g paneer and 1 boiled potato. Mix with 2 tbsp corn flour, 1 tsp garam masala, salt
Take small portion, flatten, place 2-3 raisins in center, shape into smooth balls
Deep fry kofta on medium heat until golden brown. Drain and keep aside
For gravy: Soak 10 cashews in warm water for 15 minutes. Grind to smooth paste
Heat 2 tbsp ghee, sauté 2 chopped onions until golden. Add 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste
Add 3 chopped tomatoes, cook until soft. Cool and grind to smooth paste
Heat 2 tbsp butter, add onion-tomato paste. Cook until oil separates
Add cashew paste, 1 tsp garam masala, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1 tsp red chili powder. Cook for 5 minutes
Add 1 cup water, 1/2 cup cream. Simmer for 10 minutes
Add kofta just before serving. Garnish with cream and coriander
recipes.description: Cottage cheese dumplings in rich gravy

recipes.name: Bisi Bele Bath
instructions: Cook 1 cup rice and 1/2 cup toor dal together in pressure cooker with 4 cups water, 1/2 tsp turmeric for 4 whistles
Soak lemon-sized tamarind in warm water for 15 minutes. Extract thick juice
Cook 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrot, beans, peas, potato) with tamarind extract, 3 tbsp Bisi Bele Bath powder, and salt
Mash cooked rice-dal mixture slightly and add to vegetables
Add 1 tbsp jaggery for balance of flavors. Mix well and simmer for 10 minutes
Add water if too thick. Consistency should be like porridge
For tempering: Heat 3 tbsp ghee, add 1 tsp mustard seeds, 1 tsp urad dal, 10 curry leaves, 2 dry red chilies, 10 cashews
Add tempering to bath. Mix well and serve hot
Traditionally served with potato chips or papad

recipes.name: Rajma Chawal
instructions: Soak 1.5 cups kidney beans overnight (at least 8 hours)
Pressure cook rajma with salt and 4 cups water for 6-7 whistles until completely soft
Heat 3 tbsp oil, add 1 tsp cumin seeds. Add 2 finely chopped onions, sauté until golden
Add 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, cook for 1 minute until raw smell disappears
Add 3 finely chopped tomatoes, cook until soft and mushy (8-10 minutes)
Add 2 tbsp rajma masala, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric. Cook for 2 minutes
Add cooked rajma with its water. Simmer for 15-20 minutes
Mash some rajma with back of spoon to thicken gravy
Garnish with coriander. Serve hot with steamed rice and lemon wedges

recipes.name: Uttapam
instructions: Take fermented dosa batter (same as dosa batter but slightly thicker)
Add finely chopped 1 onion, 1 tomato, 2 green chilies, 2 tbsp coriander, 2 tbsp grated carrot to batter
Mix vegetables into batter (you can also sprinkle on top while cooking)
Heat tawa, pour ladle of batter. Do not spread thin like dosa
Keep thickness of about 1/2 inch. Drizzle oil around edges
Cook on medium heat until bottom is golden brown (4-5 minutes)
Flip carefully and cook other side for 2-3 minutes until vegetables are slightly cooked
Press gently with spatula while cooking
Serve hot with sambar and coconut chutney. No need to fold

recipes.name: Aloo Gobi
instructions: Cut 3 potatoes into cubes and 1 medium cauliflower into florets
Parboil cauliflower in salted water for 3-4 minutes. Drain completely
Heat 3 tbsp oil, add 1 tsp cumin seeds. When they splutter, add 1 chopped onion
Sauté onion until golden. Add 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, cook for 1 minute
Add 2 chopped tomatoes, cook until soft and mushy
Add 1 tsp turmeric, 2 tsp coriander powder, 1 tsp red chili powder, salt. Cook for 2 minutes
Add potato cubes, mix well. Cover and cook for 5-7 minutes until potatoes are half cooked
Add cauliflower florets, mix gently. Cover and cook on low heat for 10-12 minutes
Sprinkle 1 tsp garam masala, 2 tbsp coriander leaves. Mix gently
Serve hot with roti or paratha. Do not overcook cauliflower

recipes.name: Rasam
instructions: Soak lemon-sized tamarind in 1 cup warm water for 15 minutes. Extract thick juice
Crush 2 tomatoes with hands or blender. Keep aside
In pot, add tamarind extract, crushed tomatoes, 2 tbsp rasam powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric, salt
Add 3 cups water and bring to boil. Simmer for 10 minutes until raw smell disappears
For tempering: Heat 2 tbsp ghee, add 1 tsp mustard seeds, 1 tsp cumin seeds, 1 tsp pepper corns (crushed)
Add 4 garlic cloves (crushed), 2 dry red chilies, 10 curry leaves
When garlic turns golden, add tempering to rasam. Switch off immediately
Garnish with coriander leaves. Cover and let it sit for 5 minutes
Serve as soup or with rice. Perfect for cold and digestion
recipes.description: Tangy and spicy South Indian soup

recipes.name: Kadai Paneer
instructions: Cut 250g paneer into cubes, 2 capsicums into squares, 1 onion into cubes
Blanch 4 tomatoes in hot water, peel and puree
Heat 2 tbsp oil, sauté paneer cubes until lightly golden. Remove and keep aside
In same oil, add 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, cook for 1 minute
Add onion cubes, sauté for 2 minutes. Add capsicum, sauté for 2 more minutes (keep crunchy)
Add tomato puree, cook until oil separates (8-10 minutes)
Add 2 tbsp kadai masala, 1 tsp red chili powder, salt. Cook for 2 minutes
Add 1/4 cup water and paneer cubes. Simmer for 5 minutes
Add 1 tsp kasuri methi (crushed), 2 tbsp cream. Mix gently
Garnish with coriander. Serve hot with naan or roti

recipes.name: Appam with Stew
instructions: Soak 2 cups rice for 4 hours. Grind with 1/2 cup grated coconut and 1/4 cup cooked rice to smooth batter
Add 1/2 cup thin coconut milk, 1 tsp sugar, 1/2 tsp yeast dissolved in 2 tbsp warm water, and salt
Ferment for 8 hours or overnight until bubbly
For stew: Heat 2 tbsp coconut oil, add 1 tsp mustard seeds, 2 dry red chilies, 10 curry leaves
Add 2 sliced onions, 1 inch ginger (julienned). Sauté until onions are soft
Add 2 cups mixed vegetables (carrot, beans, peas, potato). Sauté for 2 minutes
Add 2 cups thin coconut milk, salt. Cook until vegetables are tender
Add 1/2 cup thick coconut milk, switch off. Do not boil after adding thick milk
For appam: Heat appam pan, pour ladle of batter, swirl to make thin edges and thick center
Cover and cook on medium heat until edges are crispy and center is cooked
Serve appam with vegetable stew
recipes.description: Lacy rice hoppers with coconut stew

recipes.name: Fish Curry
instructions: Clean and cut 500g fish pieces (seer fish or king fish). Marinate with 1/2 tsp turmeric and salt for 15 minutes
Grind 1 cup grated coconut with 2 tbsp coriander seeds, 4 dry red chilies, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 1 marble-sized tamarind to smooth paste with water
Heat 3 tbsp coconut oil, add 1/2 tsp mustard seeds, 1/2 tsp fenugreek seeds, 10 curry leaves
When seeds splutter, add ground coconut paste. Cook for 5-6 minutes until raw smell disappears
Add 2 cups water, salt to taste. Bring to boil and simmer for 10 minutes
Gently add fish pieces. Simmer for 8-10 minutes on low heat (do not stir vigorously)
Add 1 tsp coconut oil on top. Switch off and cover for 5 minutes
Garnish with curry leaves. Serve hot with rice

recipes.name: Pav Bhaji
instructions: Pressure cook 3 potatoes, 1 cup cauliflower, 1/2 cup peas, 2 carrots until soft. Mash coarsely
Heat 3 tbsp butter, add 2 finely chopped onions. Sauté until translucent
Add 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, cook for 1 minute. Add 3 finely chopped tomatoes, cook until mushy
Add 3 tbsp pav bhaji masala, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric. Cook for 2 minutes
Add mashed vegetables and 1 cup water. Mash well while cooking for 10 minutes
Add 2 tbsp butter, mix well. Bhaji should be thick but spreadable
For pav: Slice pav buns horizontally. Heat tawa, add 1 tbsp butter
Toast pav on both sides until golden and buttery
Serve bhaji hot with buttered pav, chopped onions, and lemon wedges

recipes.name: Mysore Bonda
instructions: Soak 1 cup urad dal for 4 hours. Drain completely
Grind to thick, fluffy batter without adding water (use sprinkles if needed)
Add 2 tbsp rice flour, 1 tsp crushed pepper, 1 tsp cumin, 1 inch ginger (finely chopped), 10 curry leaves (chopped), 2 green chilies (chopped), salt
Beat batter well for 10 minutes until light and airy (secret to soft bonda)
Add 2 tbsp yogurt and mix well. Ferment for 2 hours
Just before frying, add 1/4 tsp baking soda (optional for extra fluffiness)
Heat oil for deep frying. Wet hands, take lemon-sized batter, shape into smooth balls
Gently slide into medium-hot oil. Fry until golden brown (4-5 minutes)
Do not overcrowd pan. Drain on paper towel
Serve hot with coconut chutney or sambar

recipes.name: Chicken Tikka Masala
instructions: Cut 500g chicken breast into 1.5-inch cubes
Marinate with 1 cup yogurt, 2 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, 2 tbsp tikka masala, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 tsp turmeric, 2 tbsp oil, and salt for 4 hours
Skewer marinated chicken and grill in oven at 200°C for 15-20 minutes until cooked and slightly charred
For gravy: Heat 2 tbsp butter, sauté 2 chopped onions until golden
Add 1 tbsp ginger-garlic paste, cook for 1 minute. Add 4 pureed tomatoes, cook until oil separates
Add 1 tbsp tikka masala, 1 tsp red chili powder, 1/2 cup cream. Cook for 5 minutes
Add 1/2 cup water and simmer for 10 minutes. Blend to smooth gravy if desired
Add grilled chicken tikka to gravy. Simmer for 5 minutes
Add 1 tsp kasuri methi (crushed), 2 tbsp cream. Mix gently
Garnish with cream and coriander. Serve hot with naan or rice
recipes.description: Grilled chicken in creamy tomato gravy
